entries: If you rest outdoors for 10 minutes during the day, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier  half your level. You gain this benefit in addition to any healing from {@action Treat Wounds}. Leshies whose plant nourishment does not rely on photosynthesis require a similarly suitable environment. For example, fungus leshies need dark, damp environments and a pile of decaying plant matter.

feat.name: Sow Rumor
entries: You spread rumors, which may or may not be true, about a specific subject. If the subject of your rumor is not currently the subject of any contradictory rumors, this takes as long as it would normally take you to {@action Gather Information} (typically 2 hours), at the end of which the GM rolls a secret {@skill Deception} check to see how well you spread the rumor. If your rumor matches any current rumors about the subject, it takes less time to spread the rumor, and if you are attempting to overtake a particularly popular and contradictory rumor, it takes much longer or may be impossible.
The DC similarly increases or decreases depending on how plausible your rumor is.

entries.Critical Success: Your rumor spreads like wildfire. Anyone who succeeds at a check to {@action Gather Information} on the specific subject learns your rumor in preference to other rumors about the subject. Your rumor persists for 1 month.
entries.Success: You successfully spread the rumor. Anyone who succeeds at a check to {@action Gather Information} on the specific subject adds your rumor to the list of rumors they could learn about the subject. Your rumor persists for 1 week.
entries.Failure: Your rumor dies off, never becoming popular enough for other people to learn it via {@action Gather Information}.
entries.Critical Failure: You are unable to spread a rumor and take a –4 circumstance penalty to {@skill Deception} checks to Sow Rumors about the same subject within the same region for 1 week. In addition, a rumor spreads about someone trying to spread false rumors about the subject.

feat.name: Speak With Kindred
entries: You have a connection with creatures that share your physiology.

You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the {@skill Diplomacy} skill with plants or fungi that match your leshy heritage. Generally, fungus leshies can speak to mushrooms and fungi; gourd leshies can speak to gourds, melons, and similar fruiting plants; leaf leshies can speak with deciduous trees; and vine leshies can speak with vines and climbing plants. The GM determines which plants or fungi count for this ability.

feat.name: Spellmaster Dedication
feat.prerequisites: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma 14; ability to cast focus spells; member of the Pathfinder Society affiliated with the School of Spells
entries: As a Spellmaster, you are adept at identifying magic. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus when you {@action Identify Magic} with a skill in which you are trained or better. If you have the Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer feat (Lost Omens World Guide 23), you can change the cantrip you chose for that feat each day during your daily preparations.
feat.special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Spellmaster archetype.

feat.name: Spellmaster's Resilience
entries: Your experience with a specific type of harmful magic makes you more resistant to it. Choose a magical tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal). You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells and effects with that tradition's trait and resistance 5 to all damage from spells and effects with that tradition's trait. The effect must have actually been cast or created with that tradition, rather than simply being on that tradition's spell list.

feat.name: Sun Blade
entries: You can unleash burning sunlight from your sword or spear. You gain the {@spell sun blade|LOCG} devotion spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

feat.name: Surface Culture
entries: Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the {@skill Society} skill (or another skill of your choice if you were already trained in {@skill Society}), and you gain the {@skill Lore||Additional Lore} skill feat for the {@skill Lore} corresponding to your culture (for instance, {@skill Lore||Ouat Lore} or {@skill Lore||Pahmet Lore}).

feat.name: Surreptitious Spellcaster
entries: You've learned that it pays for a Pathfinder to be able to cast spells without being noticed. You gain the Conceal Spell wizard class feat (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 210), though it's not a wizard feat for you. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks to Conceal a Spell and to {@skill Deception} checks to conceal verbal components.

feat.name: Survivor Of Desolation
entries: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against unnatural weather events or environmental hazards occurring in blighted or otherwise unnaturally marred regions. If you roll a success on a saving throw against such an effect, you get a critical success instead; if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. This does not apply to unnatural events created or directed by active effects, such as spells that create anomalous weather or hazardous areas.

feat.name: Swift Swimmer
entries: You swim faster than most iruxi. Your swim Speed increases to 25 feet.

feat.name: Swordmaster Dedication
feat.prerequisites: Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution 14; member of the Pathfinder Society affiliated with the School of Swords
entries: Your Swords training taught you to never lose hold of your weapon. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when foes attempt to {@action Disarm} you. If you have the Deft Cooperation feat (Lost Omens World Guide 23) and critically succeed on a check to {@action Aid} an ally's attack roll or skill check, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus from Deft Cooperation (instead of a +1 bonus) the first time you attempt an attack roll or attempt a skill check where the bonus would apply.
feat.special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Swordmaster archetype.

feat.name: Synergistic Spell
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Halcyon Spellcasting Initiate|LOCG}, {@feat Fulminating Synergy|LOCG}, legendary in {@skill Arcana} and {@skill Nature}
entries: You combine your synergy and spells into a fantastic web of magic, allowing you to cast two spells at once. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell} from one of your halcyon spell slots, after that spell resolves, you can Cast another Spell as a free action. This spell must be cast from one of your halcyon spell slots and be a spell that would normally take two actions to cast.

feat.name: Tail Spin
feat.prerequisites: {@ancestry goblin|crb|tailed goblin|tailed goblin} heritage, {@feat Hard Tail|LOCG}
entries: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.
Attempt a single {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Trip} up to two adjacent creatures. If you roll a success against a target, you get a critical success against that target instead.

feat.name: Tail Whip
entries: By birth or through training, your tail is strong enough to make for a powerful melee weapon. You gain a tail unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and has the {@trait sweep} trait.

feat.name: Tempest-sun Redirection
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Magaambyan Attendant Dedication|LOCG}, Tempest-Sun Mages affiliation
entries: If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell} from your spell slots that damages other creatures, you can bend some of that spell's offensive energy, protecting allies in the area and boosting your own defenses against certain foes. Select any number of targets of the spell and reduce the spell's damage to those targets by an amount equal to the spell's level. Until your next turn, when one of those targets damages you, that damage is reduced by twice the spell's level.

feat.name: Tempest-sun Shielding
feat.trigger: You or an ally within 30 feet takes damage.
entries: You transform unrealized spell energy into a protective shield. If you're a spontaneous spellcaster, expend a spell slot; if you're a prepared spellcaster, expend a spell prepared in a spell slot. Reduce the triggering damage by an amount equal to four times the level of the expended slot or spell.

feat.name: Terrain Advantage
entries: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes' defenses.

Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain are {@condition flatfooted} to you. If you have a swim Speed, non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are also {@condition flat-footed} to you.

feat.name: Theoretical Acumen
feat.trigger: You succeed at a skill check to {@action Recall Knowledge} to identify a creature.
entries: You study a creature's form and behavior to hypothesize likely means of overcoming its strengths. Once before the end of your next turn, you can use the skill modifier from the triggering check in place of your saving throw modifier against one of the creature's abilities, in place of your {@skill Perception} modifier to {@action Seek} the creature, in place of your {@skill Deception} modifier to {@action Feint} against the creature, or in place of your {@skill Intimidation} modifier to {@action Demoralize} the creature. Alternatively, against one of the creature's attacks, you can use your DC for the skill used in the triggering check in place of your AC.

feat.name: Tomb-watcher's Glare
entries: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy's heart. The undead is {@condition enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

feat.name: Torch Goblin
entries: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.

You can light yourself thoroughly on fire with a held torch, a bottle of alchemist's fire, or a similar incendiary, dealing yourself {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire damage}. As long as you are suffering {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire damage}, all your melee attacks against adjacent creatures deal an additional 1 fire damage per weapon damage die. Any creature that successfully Grapples, Shoves, or Trips you takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage; if it uses a weapon for that action, the weapon takes the damage instead. You must still attempt the flat check to remove the {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire damage} each round, as normal.

feat.name: Tree Climber
feat.prerequisites: {@ancestry goblin|crb|tailed goblin|tailed goblin} or {@ancestry goblin|crb|treedweller goblin|treedweller goblin} heritage
entries: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet. If you also have the.

feat.name: Tupilaq Carver
feat.prerequisites: You have a spellcasting class feature with the divine or primal tradition
entries: You know the truth behind old stories that tell of sending a fetish of bone and sinew to seek vengeance. These old magics allow you to conjure constructs with ease.

Add the {@spell summon construct} spell to your spell list. The constructs you summon have a distinct ivory scrimshaw appearance, and if you include a drop of blood, lock of hair, or other portion of a creature's body as part of the spell's material component, the summoned construct gains a +4 status bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to sense or locate that creature.

feat.name: Tusks
entries: Most half-orcs have visible tusks, but yours are particularly large and sharp, capable of gouging deep wounds. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.
feat.special: You can take this feat only at 1st level, and you can't retrain out of this feat or into this feat.

feat.name: Unassuming Dedication
entries: Your family instilled the values of care and patience into you from a young age.
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to perform a downtime activity.

feat.name: Unbreakable-er Goblin
entries: As hard as most {@ancestry goblin|crb|unbreakable goblin|unbreakable goblins} are to break, you are that much harder to break. You gain 20 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 10. When you fall, you take no falling damage. If you have the {@feat Bouncy Goblin|APG} feat, after falling or jumping from a height of at least 20 feet, you can bounce back into the air, up to half the distance you fell (and half as far forward if you jumped). These bounces continue until you bounce less than 20 feet.

feat.name: Undaunted
entries: Your spirit has endured many challenges over its long existence, and you are certain you can overcome whatever hardships life throws your way. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against {@trait emotion} effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an {@trait emotion} effect, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Unexpected Shift
feat.trigger: You would take damage from an attack, spell, or other effect.
entries: Your supernatural connection sometimes causes you to phase from reality when under threat, disappearing for split seconds before reappearing—often surprising you as much as your enemies. Roll a DC {@flatDC 16} flat check. On a success, you gain resistance to all damage equal to your level against the triggering effect, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against that effect until the start of your turn, and you gain the {@condition dazzled} condition for 1 round.

feat.name: Unravel Mysteries
feat.prerequisites: master in a {@action Decipher Writing} skill, {@feat Scrollmaster Dedication|LOCG}
entries: You can understand the true meaning of texts quickly, and even when you get lost or hit a dead end, you aren't discouraged from making further attempts to get to the bottom of things. When you {@action Decipher Writing}, you need only half as long as usual (reducing the time from about 1 minute to about half a minute per page), and if you fail, you don't take the usual –2 circumstance penalty to further checks to decipher that text.

feat.name: Unshakable Idealism
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Knight Vigilant|LOCG}, expert in Will saves
entries: Your faith and hope can't be shaken, and you won't flee when lives are at stake. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saves against {@trait fear} effects and {@trait emotion} effects that inflict despair. When you would gain the {@condition fleeing} condition, you can choose to stand your ground and be {@condition stunned} for the effect's duration as well, preventing you from running and allowing you to re-enter the fight more quickly when the effect ends.

feat.name: Uzunjati Recollection
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Uzunjati Storytelling|LOCG}, master in a {@action Recall Knowledge} skill
entries: You tell a story spontaneously from nearly forgotten facts, delving into your memory and entertaining your audience in the process. {@action Recall Knowledge} with a skill in which you have master proficiency, then use Uzunjati Storytelling with the same skill. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your skill check for Uzunjati Storytelling from the added details.

Halcyon Speaker One of Old-Mage Jatembe's central lessons was that magic was magic, no matter what the source. Though the Magaambya seeks to hold true to Jatembe's teachings by aiming to understand magic of all kinds, the mages of the Magaambya have found the most success with magic rooted in the material world. Halcyon speakers are powerful conversants who epitomize the Magaambyan practice of blending arcane and primal magic, seeing both traditions as flowing from the same wellspring.

feat.name: Uzunjati Storytelling
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Magaambyan Attendant Dedication|LOCG}, Uzunjati affiliation, master in a {@action Recall Knowledge} skill
entries: You tell a quick story or begin telling a longer tale. This is most useful when you want to prove your scholarly credibility or impress someone quickly. Roll a check with a skill that can be used to {@action Recall Knowledge} in which you have expert proficiency, using the result entry for the {@action Perform} action (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 250). Like Performing, Storytelling rarely has an effect on its own, but it might influence the DCs of subsequent {@skill Diplomacy} checks against the observers—or even change their attitudes—if the GM sees fit. This action is not a {@skill Performance} and cannot be used in place of anything that requires you to {@action Perform}.

feat.name: Vibrant Display
entries: Whereas most gnomes' coloration is static or changes slowly, you can cause your hair, eye, and skin color to scintillate in brief and disorienting bursts. Once every 10 minutes, when you use the {@action Feint} action, you can compare your {@skill Deception} check result to the {@skill Perception} DCs of all adjacent creatures rather than just one creature within melee reach. It's possible to get a different degree of success for each target.

These changes are imprecise and usually short-lived, so while they allow you to periodically change your appearance in unpredictable ways, they are of little use in providing camouflage or aiding a disguise.

feat.name: Vigorous Health
entries: Your physique is robust and can withstand blood loss startlingly well. Whenever you would gain the {@condition drained} condition, you can attempt a DC {@flatDC 17} flat check. On a success, you don't gain the {@condition drained} condition.

feat.name: Viking Shieldbearer
entries: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself. You gain the {@action Shield Block} reaction and are trained in your choice of the battle axe or longsword.

feat.name: Virtue-forged Tattoos
entries: Your tattoos are a work of eldritch genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin. Choose a 3rd-level arcane spell from the same school as your Arcane Tattoos, either a common spell or another to which you have access, including a lower-level spell heightened to 3rd level if you wish.
You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.

feat.name: Wandering Heart
feat.prerequisites: {@ancestry elf|crb|arctic elf|arctic elf}, {@ancestry elf|crb|cavern elf|cavern elf}, {@ancestry elf|crb|desert elf|desert elf}, {@ancestry elf|crb|woodland elf|woodland elf}, or any other elf heritage based on adapting to an environment
entries: While all elves adapt to their environments over time, you have traveled so widely and become attuned to so many environs that your body now changes more rapidly than other elves. After spending a week in an environment associated with an elf heritage (such as snow for {@ancestry elf|crb|arctic elf|arctic elf}, or a forest or jungle for {@ancestry elf|crb|woodland elf|woodland elf}) your heritage automatically changes to become that heritage. This never causes you to change to an elf heritage that isn't related to an environment, such as {@ancestry elf|crb|ancient elf|ancient elf}, {@ancestry elf|crb|seer elf|seer elf}, or {@ancestry elf|crb|whisper elf|whisper elf}.

feat.name: Ward Casting
feat.trigger: You attempt a flat check for Steady Spellcasting, but you haven't rolled yet.
entries: You carefully ward your spell by drawing from a mantle of magical energy you prepared to protect your casting, increasing your chance of retaining the spell. You reduce the DC of the flat check for Steady Spellcasting from 15 to 10.

feat.name: Wavetouched Paragon
entries: You have been blessed by the sea, granting you the ability to swim like a fish.
You gain a 15-foot swim Speed.

feat.name: Wildborn Adept
entries: The whispers of the jungle grant you more diverse access to simple primal magic. You can cast {@spell dancing lights}, disrupt undead, and tanglefoot as innate primal spells at will.
If you chose one of those spells with Wildborn Magic, you can select a new spell for Wildborn Magic.

feat.name: Wildborn Magic
entries: You have learned to access the old magic of wild places. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 314). You can cast this cantrip as an innate primal spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

feat.name: Witch Warden
entries: You and your family have fought long and hard against witches, particularly the winter witches of Irrisen, and you've learned to be wary of their curses and the otherworldly powers their patrons grant. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against curses, and to saving throws against spells cast by a witch or hag. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a curse or a spell cast by a witch or hag, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Woodcraft
entries: You have a innate familiarity with forested areas. When in a forest or jungle environment, if you roll a critical failure on a {@skill Survival} skill check to {@action Sense Direction}, {@action Subsist}, or {@action Cover Tracks}, you get a failure instead, and if you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.
